misconceptions.inferred_category_name: None (logic is correct for right-rotate by 1)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that saving the last element, shifting all other elements right by one index, then writing the saved last element into index 0 will implement a one-position right shift with wrap-around.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected. This matches Java’s array semantics and execution model: array assignments overwrite elements, so you must preserve the last value before shifting to avoid losing it.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct shifted output for N>0 and handles N=0 by doing nothing and printing an empty shifted line.
